content: Singaporean Anglican archdeacon [The Venerable](/wiki/The_Venerable) [Reverend](/wiki/Reverend) [Dr](/wiki/Doctor_(title)) **Devasahayam David Chelliah** (14 March 1894 â€“ 2 April 1979) [JP](/wiki/Justice_of_the_Peace#United_Kingdom) [OBE](/wiki/Officer_of_the_Order_of_the_British_Empire), was the first Asian [Archdeacon](/wiki/Archdeacon) of [Singapore](/wiki/Singapore). ## Early life and education Born in the [Tirunelveli district](/wiki/Tirunelveli_district), [South India](/wiki/South_India) on 14 March 1894, he was the fifth of the nine children. Chelliah moved to [Penang](/wiki/Penang), [Malaya](/wiki/British_Malaya) at the age of seventeen to take up a job offer as the Headmaster of an Anglican school. In early 1912 he became a Headmaster of St George's Mission Primary School. In 1915 he became one of the staff of [Anglo-Chinese School](/wiki/Anglo-Chinese_School,_Penang) which was managed by the American Methodist Mission. Chelliah left for [London](/wiki/London) in September 1922 to study at the [University of London](/wiki/University_of_London) and graduated with Honours Degree (External) in 1923. He extended his study leave to attended the [London Day Training College](/wiki/London_Day_Training_College) and obtained a Post-Graduate Diploma in Teaching in 1924. Following which, he returned to Malaya to marry to his wife. Chelliah got his [PhD](/wiki/PhD) from the University of London in June 1940. ## Priesthood Chelliah ordained as [Deacon](/wiki/Deacon) of [St Andrew's Cathedral](/wiki/St_Andrew%27s_Cathedral,_Singapore) on 20 September 1940, before moving his family to and arriving in Singapore on 31 December 1940, and as a [Priest](/wiki/Priest) in 1941. He was an [Assistant master](/wiki/Teacher) at [St Andrew's School](/wiki/Saint_Andrew%27s_School,_Singapore), [Singapore](/wiki/Singapore) from 1940 to 1946; and its [Vice Principal](/wiki/Principal_(academia)) from 1946 to 1961. He was [Acting Dean](/wiki/Dean_(religion)) of [St Andrew's Cathedral, Singapore](/wiki/St_Andrew%27s_Cathedral,_Singapore) from 1943 to 1945. He became [Archdeacon](/wiki/Archdeacon) of [Singapore](/wiki/Singapore) from 1958 to 1967. He was [Priest in charge](/wiki/Priest_in_charge) of St Paul's Church, Singapore from 1961 to 1970. He was an [Honorary Canon](/wiki/Canon_(priest)) of St Andrew's Cathedral, Singapore from 1949 to 1971; after which he was [Canon Emeritus](/wiki/Canon_(priest)). ## Personal life Upon his return to Malaya, Chelliah married Mary Ebenezer Rosalind Mani in 1925 and they had six children: - David Ernest Srinivasagam Chelliah, - Iris Ponnu Constance Nallayya - Jazmyn Margurite Elizabeth Chelliah - Jonathan Chelliah - Noelle George - [Leaena Tambyah](/wiki/Leaena_Tambyah). His wife Rosalind died on 26 November 1971. Chelliah died at the [Toa Payoh Hospital](/wiki/Toa_Payoh_Hospital), [Singapore](/wiki/Singapore) at 2.10 am on 2 April 1979 at the age of 85.
title: Devasahayam David Chelliah
